page.title: 04Harlington Church
page.content: The vicar of Harlington Church is the Rev. Jenkins.In 1085 Harlington was called Herdinstone, later Herdington. The church is dedicated to St.Peter and St.Paul.St.Peter's sign is 2 keys crossed to remind us of Jesus saying that St.Peter holds the keys to Heaven.St.Paul's sign is 2 swords crossed to represent the Bible that fights off evil things.The church is made of flint and pudding-stone.It is 900 years old.The Norman doorway is 800 years old and has a pattern on it of lions' or cats' faces.The Parish registers go back to 1540.There is also a brass eagle lectern.
